data.name: ConfigInfinityOutputTooltip
data.value: Configuration is based on RFC 5869. This means that an 8-bit counter is used and the length of the output bytes is limited to 8192. Further information can be found in the help.

data.name: PresConstructionSectionHeading
data.value: Construction HKDF SHA-256

data.name: PresConstructionSectionHeadingNum
data.value: 2. Construction of HKDF SHA-256

data.name: PresExplanationSectionHeading
data.value: HKDF SHA-256

data.name: PresIntroductionPart1Text
data.value: The function HKDF SHA-256 is a key derivation function (KDF). It uses the Keyed-Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) as a pseudorandom function (PRF). As inputs it gets the SKM and the secret key. In this implementation, the SHA-256 is used in the HMAC. This key derivation fuction is recommended by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

data.name: PresIntroductionSectionHeading
data.value: Introduction

data.name: PresIntroductionSectionHeadingNum
data.value: 1. Introduction

data.name: PresSectionIntroductionText
data.value:
<Bold>Inputs:</Bold> <Bold>Source Key Material:</Bold> Specifies the source key material (SKM)
<Bold>Salt:</Bold> Specifies the salt value for the calculation of the pseudorandom key (PRK). Does not have to be secret.
<Bold>Context Information:</Bold> Specifies the applicationspecific constant context information (CTXInfo). Can be empty.
<Bold>Length of the key material (in byte):</Bold> Specifies the length of the key material in byte.
<Bold>Outputs:</Bold> <Bold>Key Material:</Bold> After the calculation, the resulting key material (KM) is visible in the textfield.
<Bold>Debug:</Bold> The key material will be calculated in multiple steps. Each subresult will be visible in this textfield.

data.name: PresTitleHeading
data.value: HKDF SHA-256 a Key Derivation Function with extendable output length

data.name: ExToMuchOutputRequested
data.value: Please specify a smaller value for requested length of outputbytes. You specified: {0}. Allowed is only: {1}

data.name: InputCtxInfoCaption
data.value: CTXInfo

data.name: InputCtxInfoToolTip
data.value: Input of the applicationspecific constant CTXInfo

data.name: KeyMaterialDebugTextTemplate
PresConstructionPart1Text
data.value: The calculation of the key material can be described as following:

data.name: PresConstructionPart2Text
data.value: The HKDF procedure consists of two steps. In the first step, a pseudo random key (PRK) is generated. It is calculated on the basis of the SKM and an optional salt.

data.name: PresConstructionPart3Text
data.value: In step 2, the key material is calculated. For this purpose, the prk from step 1 is used as a secret key for the hmac. The KM is calculated step by step. The HKDF method uses a feedback loop and a counter for this purpose: The respective precalculated value is used as input for the subsequent calculation. The counter is incremendet in each step. The input CTXinfo is an application-specific constant, which can also be empty.

data.name: PresConstructionPart4Text
data.value: The following picture shows the second step:

data.name: PresConstructionScheme
data.value:
Step 1: Extract PRK = HMAC-SHA256(Salt, SKM)
Step 2: Expand KM(0) = empty string (zero length) KM(1) = HMAC-SHA256(PRK, KM(0) || info || CTR) KM(2) = HMAC-SHA256(PRK, KM (1) || info || CTR) … KM(n) = HMAC-SHA256(PRK, KM (n-1) || info || CTR)

data.name: PresIterationPRKCalc
PresIterationRounds

PresPRKDebugTextTemplate
PRKDebugTextTemplate
ExSystemOutOfMemory
data.value: While requesting memory from your system, there was an exception. Please try a smaller value for the output bytes.

data.name: PresErrorText
data.value: An error occured. Please find detailed information in the log of Cryptool2.

data.name: PresFinishedSectionHeading
data.value: 4. Calculation finished

data.name: PresFinishedText
data.value: To repeat the calculation, there are 3 alternatives: Either stop the execution and start it again, change one of the inputs or click on the "Restart" button. Then the calculation will restart automatically.
